blog.name: butdoireallycare
blog.title: TryingMyHardest
blog.description: I cannot help it...I have to talk shit!

summary: Sansa saying, "but bran can't have kids," is not her bringing up a valid concern, it is her last ditch effort to try and...
body: Sansa saying, “but bran can’t have kids,” is not her bringing up a valid concern, it is her last ditch effort to try and discredit her brother, so that she can become the next likely candidate. It was just more example of the shitty way she treats everybody, including her own family, when the get in the way of her obtaining power. Bran is a Stark, something Sansa herself as said multiple times regardless of him being a three-eyes Raven, and she uses that as ammunition. But. Now that they want him to be in charge? “You’re not my king”. A Stark is finally in charge, what she has supposedly wanted from the beginning, but it is the wrong Stark. Sansa has wanted nothing but power this entire time, and she has don’t whatever she needed to do to get it, no matter who she stepped over. She is not some great moral compass like everyone is trying to.make her out to be. She is a self-righteous, selfish bitch who only looks out for herself.

Game of Thrones/A Song of Ice and Fire Art Blog, None of these are original works.  If you re-blog from here, keep the artist's credits within your re-blog! Background and Avatar by the excellent Prokrik.

Spoilers in some pictures! Be wary, I'm not responsible for your discoveries!

Use the home link, or the orange top right X to navigate back home. 

Use the search or the image tags to find your favorite houses/characters. "HLS4" for histories and lore of season 4.

summary: Why do you think they left Bran out of the final Starks montage? I just found it weird! They could have added a short clip of...
question: Why do you think they left Bran out of the final Starks montage? I just found it weird! They could have added a short clip of his Coronation like Sansa! I know he is the 3ER now but he remains a Stark, despite everything Bran is the main essence inside him, however small that part is.
answer:
Idk anon, idk, because I loved that montage and the music with it is called ‘The Last of the Starks’ so I mean ??? 

The short answer to this is just that D&D stopped writing Bran properly long ago. Bran pre Three Eyed Raven? They got him. Bran post Three Eyed Raven, which is meant to be Bran with all this knowledge? They didn’t care. They erased the ‘Bran’ part of Bran alksnfdsjbafd. So maybe they missed him out because he’s ‘not really a Stark’ to which I call BOLLOCKS, MY BOY IS A STARK!!

summary: just to be perfectly clear, I do not accept Bran Stark being with anyone else than Jojen Reed, but if anyone could “reactivate”...

summary: This fits so well into my “Bran is manipulative” head canon. He was the reason the war began. He liking climbing towers for fun...
body:
This fits so well into my “Bran is manipulative” head canon. He was the reason the war began. He liking climbing towers for fun and discovered the incest of Cersei and Jaime which was the first major secret of the show. His wolf killed his assassin. His mother went on to capture Tyrion at the behest of littlefinger which began the war.

He acted as Lord of Winterfell as a child doing an excellent job as a strict leader of the Northmen. When his foster brother took the castle, he watched his caretakers and some children get murdered. He was orphaned and lost everyone he ever loved and his family home was destroyed.

He took his servant, companion, and friends into the most dangerous place in the world to obtain the power of the Three Eyed Raven. He couldn’t use his legs so he wanted to fly. He used mind control on Summer and Hodor and used it to kill people.

He did virtually nothing as most of them died horrible and tragic deaths. His friend Jojen taught him black magic and died for him. Hodor was crippled by Bran’s mind control as a child. The night king found them and marked him because he decided to walk through the army of the dead and got touched by the Night King.

He facilitated the end of all his rivals and enemies through careful manipulations. He didn’t tell anybody anything even though his knowledge could have helped. He helped Sansa and Arya kill Littlefinger. He even told his Chaos is a Ladder and Bran as we all know is a climber.

He alienated Daenerys through immediately disclosing the fact that her Dragon was the reason the wights got through the wall. He made Sam tell Jon the truth even though Sam just learned Daenerys executed his father and brother which made it much more forceful than if Bran had taken Jon aside and quietly told him the truth. He lured the Night King into the Godswood and let everyone die. He knew Arya would kill him in the exact spot he gave her the dagger. He was the one who told Sansa and Arya the truth about Jon’s parentage. He let Jaime live knowing he and Tyrion would lead Cersei to her death. He sentenced Jon, the True Heir to the wall. Even though they were sending the Dothraki and Unsullied away he still banished Jon. He could have pardoned him.

He took the Throne. His last words are that he is hunting Drogon and that they will learn to worship him as a King.

I’m pretty sure he’s the most manipulative person in the series. Even more than littlefinger. I think Bran is the foil to Littlefinger. The fact that he ascended to the throne through careful, tiny manipulations while making the climb to power means that he is actually a smarter player than littlefinger who relied on money, force, and manipulating the poor, women, and children.

summary:
lucifers-lawyer
 ha respondido a tu publicación  “Yesterday afternoon I left twitter, and tumblr, for the day. I went...”
      ...
body:
lucifers-lawyer ha respondido a tu publicación “Yesterday afternoon I left twitter, and tumblr, for the day. I went…”

Bran is literally the MOST useful character in westeros we would not have Exposition or Information without him! Point me in the haters direction, Hon, I’ve Stanned Bran for 9 years now and I’m ready to come out swinging

I’m better today. Finding and reading comments of people who felt the same, or who reblogged or read my post, or reached out to me (like this), actually helps. ^^

summary: Am I the only one who is perfectly fine with Bran being King of the Seven Realms?
title: Am I the only one who is perfectly fine with Bran being King of the Seven Realms?
body:
He’s the freakin’ three-eyed raven. He knows their past, so he will never repeat it. He sees all and is wise beyond his years.

He’s said it before. He wants for nothing. The best person for the job is the person who doesn’t want it. He seeks neither greed nor power, so he will never be cruel or betray his people.

He listens to counsel and takes support and help from those around him.

He is just and kind. He doesn’t sentence Jon and Tyrion to death. He gives them a second chance to prove themselves and face punishment and duty in life. He shows mercy, something that previous kings and queens sorely lacked.

And like Tyrion said. It’s good that he will father no children. Because now they can start anew, electing good and just leaders in the future instead of the throne being given by birthright.

They finally broke the wheel.

Hail Bran the Broken!

summary: Bran, thinking: Okay, Tyrion's made mistakes, but he's basically a good person, and I'm going to let him live out his days in...
body:
Bran, thinking: Okay, Tyrion’s made mistakes, but he’s basically a good person, and I’m going to let him live out his days in peace like he wanted.

Tyrion: “Bran the Broken!”

Bran: Actually, you know what, asshole?

reblog.comment:

blog.name: makerkenzie
blog.title: Meet the Maker
blog.description: Behold, the righteous altar to my ego. If you appreciate my sass, Buy Me a Coffee. If not, I assume you will read someone else's blog.

tags: or is it six kingdoms now
no it should be more like eight kingdoms
summary: The difference between a ruler and an advisor
title: The difference between a ruler and an advisor
body:
I just can’t see Bran as the Lord of the Six Kingdoms. Certainly not the way they positioned him in the GOT finale, with him setting up a Small Council and them still ruling from KL and still using the Red Keep. And that’s not just because Season 8 did nothing to make the case for Bran as a ruler. Although it certainly did nothing to make the case for Bran as a ruler.

I don’t think he’s being set up as a ruler in the books, either.

But he could be an advisor to rulers.

A ruler isn’t just someone running the show. A ruler is someone who inspires the people. Tywin was an administrator. He was never a ruler, and that’s because people didn’t fucking like Tywin and he didn’t want them to. Tyrion is an administrator and advisor. He’s not a ruler and he doesn’t intend to be. 

Jon, for the short time he was KitN, was a ruler. Robb was a ruler. He went out there and dealt with his people. Did he do it especially well? He certainly didn’t do it perfectly, but he accepted the role. Sansa is a ruler. She plants her feet in place and deals with her bannermen and looks after her people. 

I don’t see Bran, even in the books, being set up to fill that role. For one thing he’s still a very little boy. The way he makes decisions is not accessible to the people.

A book-version arrangement that I think is much more plausible is that the Three-Eyed Raven becomes the head of a council of rulers of the kingdoms. 

Especially in a story in which Bran contributes something essential to the fight for the living. Something a bit more relevant than serving as bait for the Night King. If the 3ER’s powers are necessary to avert the Snow Zombie Apocalypse, the other leaders would want to keep him in an advisory/ombudsman position.

And when I say “other leaders,” I mean it’s not just the North being independent while all the other kingdoms are together. I mean the destruction of KL is so thorough there’s no way to maintain a centralized authority over the realm. So the realm splits apart into autonomous kingdoms. Could be as few as 4 kingdoms, could be as many as 8 (including the Riverlands), hell, could end up being more than that. But rather than revert to the hot mess from before Aegon’s Conquest, the rulers of the kingdoms form a council so they can stay connected and cooperating, and the 3ER is the overseer of that council. And part of the duty of the council is to support the 3ER in nurturing and training a new 3ER so there’s always someone ready to fill that role. I can see Bran being set up for the overseer position, book version.

answer: Yesss. Our king has legs for days.
